thread.title: Returning from injury, Svindal is 'relaxed' after GS defeat
thread.title_full: Returning from injury, Svindal is 'relaxed' after GS defeat

title: Returning from injury, Svindal is 'relaxed' after GS defeat
text:
Returning from injury, Norway's Svindal feels 'relaxed' after trailing winner by 4.25 seconds By ERIC WILLEMSEN Associated Press   10:05   10:05   
Subjects: 
Austria (29) 

SOELDEN, Austria — Finishing 4.25 seconds behind the winner would usually drive Aksel Lund Svindal mad. On Sunday, it didn't. 
Competing in his first World Cup race in 19 months, the Norwegian placed 24th in the season-opening giant slalom, more than four seconds behind winner Ted Ligety. 
The Rettenbach glacier makes for one of the most challenging GS courses on the men's circuit, with an icy surface and a steep pitch. 
Seeking a return to his best form for upcoming speed races, the two-former overall champion says "I am feeling relaxed about this. I hoped to be faster but I also knew it would be a tough race. I wasn't really prepared for this stuff, to be honest."
